thread.title: Women's basketball: Baylor coach Kim Mulkey tallies 500th win after Lady Bears down Texas Tech | NCAA.com
thread.title_full: Women's basketball: Baylor coach Kim Mulkey tallies 500th win after Lady Bears down Texas Tech | NCAA.com

title: Women's basketball: Baylor coach Kim Mulkey tallies 500th win after Lady Bears down Texas Tech | NCAA.com

organizations.name: naismith memorial basketball hall of fame

text:
Kevin Jairaj | USA TODAY Sports Images In just 17 seasons, Kim Mulkey has posted 500 wins as head coach. Women's basketball: Baylor coach Kim Mulkey tallies 500th win after Lady Bears down Texas Tech Janie Harris | NCAA.com Contact | Archive | RSS 
As Baylor secured its 27th win this season as well as the Big 12 regular-season title, head coach Kim Mulkey tallied her 500th career win. She is the second-fastest head coach to reach this milestone, following Leon Barmore, who happens to be Mulkey’s mentor. 
RELATED: Kim Mulkey, others highlight the Naismith Memorial Basketball Hall of Fame finalists 
From her first win with Baylor (a 74-62 win over Miami (Ohio) on Nov. 18, 2000), Mulkey has transformed the Lady Bears from a program that posted a 7-20 record the year before she took over to seven consecutive Big 12 regular-season titles. 
She also led the Bears to two national titles (in 2005 and 2012) and 15 NCAA tournament appearances. Congratulations @KimMulkey !! She's the 2nd fastest to wins in DI women's basketball history. #Mulkey500 #SicEm pic.twitter.com/3InHCQriNI — Baylor Lady Bears (@BaylorWBB) February 25, 2017 
The win pushes her overall win percentage to 84.2 (To put that in perspective, Pat Summitt tallied over 1,000 total wins and posted a win percentage of 91.3, and she is considered the greatest coach in women’s basketball history).
